title: [BUG] Custom scorer gives you an error when fitting a ForecastingGridSearchCV object
body:
**Describe the bug**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->
When running a ForecastingGridSearchCV with exogenous variables with a scoring created with MetricFunctionWrapper, gives you an error.

**To Reproduce**
<!--
Add a Minimal, Complete, and Verifiable example (for more details, see e.g. https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve

If the code is too long, feel free to put it in a public gist and link it in the issue: https://gist.github.com
-->

```python
from sktime.performance_metrics.forecasting import mase_loss,sMAPE
from sktime.performance_metrics.forecasting._classes import MetricFunctionWrapper
metric = MetricFunctionWrapper(sMAPE)
cv = SlidingWindowSplitter(initial_window=int(len(yt) * 0.5))
gscv = ForecastingGridSearchCV(forecaster, cv=cv, param_grid=regressor_param_grid,scoring=metric)
gscv.fit(y=yt,X=xt)
```

**Expected behavior**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->
The forecaster should be scored with the custom metric but instead it gives you an error.
**Additional context**
<!--
Add any other context about the problem here.
-->The error that gives you is the following:
TypeError: __init__() takes 1 positional argument but 3 were given

**Versions**
0.6.0
